perturbation.original_text: VIP will maintain disaster and/or business interruption insurance adequate to establish alternate site processing, as provided for in paragraph 12(A) of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: VIP may maintain disaster and/or business interruption insurance.
perturbation.explanation: This omission weakens VIP's obligation to maintain adequate insurance for business interruption, potentially violating regulations mandating business continuity planning and risk mitigation for financial institutions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Arkansas Insurance Department regulations on business continuity and disaster recovery planning for insurance companies.

perturbation.original_text: VIP shall indemnify, defend and hold BNL and its officers, directors, stockholders, employees, agents and representatives harmless from any and all claims, actions, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees and expenses, arising out of any third party claims of infringement of any United States patents, or a trade secret, or any copyright, trademark, service mark, trade name or similar proprietary rights alleged to have occurred related to VIP's providing of EDP Services pursuant to this Agreement or relating to the VIP System used in providing such EDP Services.
perturbation.changed_text: VIP shall indemnify BNL from third party claims of infringement of any United States patents, or a trade secret related to VIP's providing of EDP Services pursuant to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'defend and hold harmless' and limiting the scope of indemnification, this weakens BNL's protection against intellectual property claims, potentially violating regulations requiring insurance companies to have adequate protection against such risks and to be held harmless.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding indemnification and hold harmless agreements, and insurance regulations requiring adequate risk management.

perturbation.original_text: Maintain property insurance in an amount sufficient to replace or reconstruct the hardware, software, data and facilities necessary for VIP to operate the VIP System and otherwise provide the EDP Services set forth in this Agreement and, upon written request, shall provide BNL with evidence of the coverage, including all applicable limits and conditions, and, upon written request, shall provide BNL with evidence of all renewals, cancellations, expirations or modifications of the coverage;
perturbation.changed_text: Maintain property insurance, and shall provide BNL with evidence of the coverage upon request.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the clause 'in an amount sufficient to replace or reconstruct the hardware, software, data and facilities necessary for VIP to operate the VIP System and otherwise provide the EDP Services set forth in this Agreement' and 'including all applicable limits and conditions, and, upon written request, shall provide BNL with evidence of all renewals, cancellations, expirations or modifications of the coverage;' significantly reduces the assurance that VIP has adequate coverage and transparency towards BNL, violating Arkansas insurance regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Arkansas Insurance Department regulations requiring adequate insurance coverage and transparency in business relationships.
